solution.text:
If we see carefully , the line joining the boy -> tower base -> tower top -> boy
will approximately form a triangle that is right-angled at the base of the tower
then by using Pythagoras we find the hypotenuse of this triangle
hypotenuse = distance travelled by the stone
hypotenuse=\(\sqrt{_{{j*3}}_^2+_{{j*4}}_^2}\)
distance=_{{j*5}}_ metres
sinB=\(Perpendicular\over hypotenuse\), as hypotenuse is the longest side of any triangle
sinB can never be > 1
